thread.title: DPS trooper snaps photo with Cowboys player during traffic stop
thread.title_full: DPS trooper snaps photo with Cowboys player during traffic stop

title: DPS trooper snaps photo with Cowboys player during traffic stop
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest DPS trooper snaps photo with Cowboys player during traffic stop A Texas Department of Public Safety trooper faces a procedural review after taking a photo with a Dallas Cowboys player during a traffic stop Sunday. Post to Facebook DPS trooper snaps photo with Cowboys player during traffic stop A Texas Department of Public Safety trooper faces a procedural review after taking a photo with a Dallas Cowboys player during a traffic stop Sunday.  //on.wfaa.com/1RFmzn3   DPS trooper snaps photo with Cowboys player during traffic stop Landon Haaf, WFAA Sports 1 p.m. CDT October 13, 2015 The trooper faces discipline after posing for the photo This photo posted to Christine Michael's Instagram account has a DPS trooper in hot water (Photo: @chrismike33 on Instagram) CONNECT 16 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A Texas Department of Public Safety trooper faces a procedural review after taking a photo with a Dallas Cowboys player during a traffic stop Sunday. 
At around noon Sunday – just over three hours before the Cowboys’ 3 p.m. kickoff against the Patriots – a trooper pulled over Cowboys backup running back Christine Michael for windshield tint that appeared to be illegal, DPS officials told News 8. 
Michael stopped his black Bentley on the shoulder of the President George Bush Turnpike. He was not issued a ticket, but the trooper asked him to get out of his vehicle to take a photo. 
That photo was later posted to Michael’s Instagram account with the caption, "Got stopped just to take a picture." A photo posted by Christine Michael (@chrismike33) on Oct 11, 2015 at 10:56am PDT 
“The trooper’s actions have been reviewed by DPS and are not consistent with department procedure,” a DPS spokesperson said. 
“In conversations with his chain of command, the trooper realized his error in judgement and was apologetic for the incident.” 
Michael, who was acquired by the Cowboys a week before the 2015 season, has just two carries for five yards on the season. He rushed one time for six yards during the game after the incident with the DPS trooper. 
He was a second-round pick out of Texas A&M in the 2013 NFL Draft. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1RFmzn3 TOP VIDEOS
